metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3634 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
rsyslog before 7.6.6 and 8.x before 8.4.1 and sysklogd 1.5 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash), possibly execute arbitrary code, or have other unspecified impact via a crafted priority (PRI) value that triggers an out-of-bounds array access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3634` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

rsyslog - 7.4.4-1ubuntu11
rsyslog-elasticsearch - 7.4.4-1ubuntu11
rsyslog-gnutls - 7.4.4-1ubuntu11
rsyslog-gssapi - 7.4.4-1ubuntu11
rsyslog-mysql - 7.4.4-1ubuntu11
rsyslog-pgsql - 7.4.4-1ubuntu11
rsyslog-relp - 7.4.4-1ubuntu11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> also see followup issue CVE-2014-3683

criterions.comment: rsyslog package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.4.4-1ubuntu11').
